title: [Large-scale] Predicting E-Learning System Adoption: TAM-Based Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental computer and smartphone operation skills, with online learning platform experience
context.additional_context: Conducted in a limited technological environment centered on smartphones, measuring learning outcomes through project-based assessment

learning_goals: Learners can explain the core components of the Technology Acceptance Model (TAM), including perceived usefulness and perceived ease of use.
Learners can apply methods to analyze e-learning system acceptance factors using TAM.
Learners can write policy proposals for effective online learning design in constrained technological environments.

resources: Smartphone or Tablet, Zoom Account, Basic Survey Tools (e.g., Google Forms)
TAM (Technology Acceptance Model) Explanation Materials (PDF/Image Files)
PLS (Partial Least Squares) Analysis Concept Guide (Condensed Version)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
